intro: Huidobria chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean huidobria, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Chile. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, powdery coating. Huidobria chilensis is adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and sandy soils.
